results.title: Australian war memorial
results.creator_credit: John Gray, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An overview of the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, the quiet cloisters within it and the pictures, exhibits, dioramas, paintings, models and objects of war which recall the battles fought by Australians. Features the paintings and models which depict the 1915 Anzac landings in Turkey.

results.title: Australian snakes
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the four families of snakes found in Australia: pythons, elapids, colubrids, and typhlops. Highlights differences in colour, size, pattern, habitat and temperament. Narrated by Max Taylor. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australian reporter
results.brief_description: Magazine film comprising three items: Asian concert in Sydney at the Conservatorium of Music, asian students present a concert in aid of the Royal Blind Society; Young farmers, this movement introduces boys and girls to the science (and chores) of modern farming; Radio Australia, this international station uses experts from overseas and well-stocked libraries to maintain world-wide appeal. No other credits available.

results.title: The Australian plague locust
results.creator_credit: Howard Hughes, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Department of Agriculture Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Plague Locust, unique to Australia, is one of the major pests which attack crops, particularly in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Discusses the characteristics of the locust, the reasons for plagues, and the efforts to predict and control outbreaks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Hughes, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Department of Agriculture Film Unit

results.title: The Australian Outward Bound School
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School on the Hawkesbury River is attended by young men of various backgrounds, from all parts of Australia and Papua New Guinea. Here they share many adventures - bushwalking, rock climbing and boating. Before participating in any expeditions they learn the fundamentals of map and compass reading, first aid and safety. The course is designed to teach self-discipline, give confidence, a sense of responsibility and achievement. Wholehearted participation in all activities prepares the boys to take their places in the community always remembering the Outward Bound motto - “To serve, to strive, and not to yield”. No credits available - donated by the Shell Company of Australia.

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: John Morris, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Surveys the teaching and research facilities of the Australian National University. Shows examples of investigations being pursued in microbiology, botany, geophysics, English, law, archaeology, Indonesian, literature, zoology, demography, astronomy, and political science. Photography: Tom Cowan; Music: Moneta Eagles.

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The National University in Canberra opened in 1946 is a University new in foundation and purpose. It is for post graduate studies only, and the work undertaken there is on projects related to original research designed to add to the sum of human knowledge. There are four research schools connected with medical research, physical sciences, Pacific studies and social sciences. The purpose of the University is to allow concentration on research and by so doing attract some of the best brains to remain in Australia instead of going to research centres overseas.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 136
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Four generations: Golden Jubilee of War Veteran’s Homes; four generations of ex-servicemen have benefited from this service. Camp Southern Cross: International camp is one of the activities held throughout the world to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee Of Guiding. Held at Britannia Park, in the Dandenongs, Vic. January 1970. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian lizards
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
